snippet.title: CYBERSTELLAR  - Trailer
snippet.description:
CYBERSTELLAR - Shoot 'Em Up. First game rendered in 3D Pixel (2D Rendered Voxel). Animations following the example of some animations from the movie "Pixels". Protect Earth and Mars from alien attacks, but be careful not to lose control of the ship in stormy weather. Please add to wishlist, it helps a lot. Thank you!
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1853920/CYBERSTELLAR/

A simple and challenging game, it is yes, an indie game.

Years of much research and testing to achieve standard quality.

This animation in voxels, which does not exist in any other game. Theyre the ideal standard size measurement Ive found for this format; they may look big, but its the definitive standard. If it is different from this pattern, they lose the property of voxels when very small, or when very large they lose the objects personality.

Because of this new format(voxels animados), it is different from high poly, low poly, pixels (low resolution) and HD (high resolution pixels) graphics. The idea was to create something similar to the graphic style of some characters from the movie Pixels, where I could also switch to the Stop Motion style, which also makes the game very interesting.

Its not a casual game where the player stays in the corner of the screen with automatic fire, like in those regular spaceship games, which hits enemies and continues flying as if nothing happened; then the drunk aliens (UFO shourikens) motivate the pilot to do maneuvers and dodge the hell bullets.
A proposal not very different from common games, but with the intention of adding adrenaline until the end of the game.

0% Error!

"For art lovers, at the same time they play, they glimpse themselves."

Many liked this new format, and asked if Im going to create more games graphically in this style, I replied that yes, Im already working with the next adventure platform game, which will also follow the same size standard style.

Eternal gratitude to:
Lucas Donizeti Goncalves
Champika Sandamal Gajasinghe
Without these two Teachers, "CYBERTELLAR" would not exist.



Good luck and sucess!







Paulo Cesar
(Pixels-3D)
